Empath::

"Yeah, you proved that."  Her harsh tone abruptly softens.  "Sorry.  
Not everyone knows exactly when and how their enemy is planning to 
attack.  I should have warned you about that knife."

Empath's guilt trip is rooted in a memory of the Great War, when 
Skywarp (the love of her life) nearly got destroyed because she 
failed to warn him in time.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Condor/Windlord::
> 
> "I'm asking myself that too" thought Condor.
> 
> "'cause, you're in our side, now"replied Windlord "We belong a 
> team... and team members care each other; you showed that you can 
> take care yourself but even the must skillfull warrior can be 
> injured..."
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > Empath::
> > 
> > The 'Lady' catches up with the duo.  "Honestly, Windlord, quit 
> > worrying about me."  Empath rolls her eyes, a bit disconcerting 
> since 
> > she's in beast mode.  "I'm a Predacon, remember?  Why do I merit 
> such 
> > special treatment?"
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Rudra656@a... wrote:
> > > ::Aerotaur::
> > >        He looks up from where he was watching the Predacons 
> > leave.  "Yes, 
> > > Windlord, I am fine."  He turns and walks over to 
him.  "Although 
> > it appears 
> > > you are not."  He shrugs and gestures to the Predacons.  "But 
at 
> > least we 
> > > have won the day."
